Package com.salesforce.multicloudj.blob.driver

Class BlobStoreValidator

java.lang.Object
com.salesforce.multicloudj.blob.driver.BlobStoreValidator
public class BlobStoreValidator extends Object
Helper for validating input for BlobStore operations.

    • requireNotBlank

      public void requireNotBlank(String string, String msg)
      Inspects the input string and throws an IllegalArgumentException if the input is `null`, empty, or blank.
      Parameters:
      string - the string to inspect
      msg - the error message to use if the input is empty.

    • requireNotEmpty

      public void requireNotEmpty(Collection<?> collection, String msg)
      Inspects the input collection and throws an IllegalArgumentException if the collection is `null`, empty, or contains any values that are null, empty, or blank.
      Parameters:
      collection - the collection to inspect
      msg - the error message to use if the input is invalid.

    • requireNotEmpty

      public void requireNotEmpty(Map<String,String> map, String msg)
      Inspects the input map and throws an IllegalArgumentException if the map is empty or null
      Parameters:
      map - the map to inspect
      msg - the error message to use if the input is invalid.

    • requireEqualsIgnoreCase

      public void requireEqualsIgnoreCase(String first, String second, String msg)
      Inspects the strings and throws an IllegalArgumentException if they don't match. This is a case-insensitive comparison
      Parameters:
      first - - the first string
      second - - the second strings
      msg - the error message to use if the input is invalid.

    • validateKey

      public void validateKey(String key)
      Validates that the supplied key is not empty. This is identical to calling requireNotBlank(key, INVALID_OBJECT_NAME_MSG)
      Parameters:
      key - the key to inspect

    • validateBucket

      public void validateBucket(String bucket)
      Validates that the supplied bucket is not empty. This is identical to calling requireNotBlank(bucket, INVALID_BUCKET_NAME_MSG)
      Parameters:
      bucket - the bucket to inspect

    • validateKeys

      public void validateKeys(Collection<String> keys)
      Validates that the supplied keys are not empty. This is identical to calling requireNotEmpty(keys, INVALID_OBJECT_NAME_COLLECTION_MSG)
      Parameters:
      keys - the keys to inspect

    • validateBlobIdentifiers

      public void validateBlobIdentifiers(Collection<BlobIdentifier> objects)
      Validates that the supplied list of objects are not empty or null. Also validates that the keys are not empty or null.
      Parameters:
      objects - the BlobIdentifiers to inspect

    • validateDuration

      public void validateDuration(Duration duration)
      Validates that the supplied duration is a non-null, non-zero, positive value
      Parameters:
      duration - The duration

    • validatePresignedOperationType

      public void validatePresignedOperationType(PresignedOperation presignedOperation)
      Validates that the presigned operation is not null
      Parameters:
      presignedOperation - The PresignedOperation type

    • validate

      public void validate(UploadRequest request)
      Validates the input request. This is identical to calling validateKey(request.getKey())
      Parameters:
      request - the request to inspect.

    • validate

      public void validate(DownloadRequest request)
      Validates the input request. This is identical to calling validateKey(request.getKey())
      Parameters:
      request - the request to inspect.

    • validate

      public void validate(CopyRequest request)
      Validates the input request to ensure it has valid {srcKey, destKey, destBucket}. This is identical to calling 
      
     validateKey(request.getSrcKey());
     validateKey(request.getDestKey());
     requireNotBlank(request.getDestBucket(), INVALID_BUCKET_NAME_MSG);
      Parameters:
      request - the request to inspect.

    • validate

      public void validate(CopyFromRequest request)
      Validates the input request to ensure it has valid {srcBucket, srcKey, destKey}. This is identical to calling 
      
     validateBucket(request.getSrcBucket());
     validateKey(request.getSrcKey());
     validateKey(request.getDestKey());
      Parameters:
      request - the request to inspect.

    • validate

      public void validate(DirectoryUploadRequest request)
      Validates the input request. This validates that the request is not null and that the local source directory is not null or empty.
      Parameters:
      request - the request to inspect.

    • validate

      public void validate(DirectoryDownloadRequest request)
      Validates the input request. This validates that the request is not null and that the local destination directory is not null or empty.
      Parameters:
      request - the request to inspect.

    • validateDelete

      public void validateDelete(String key)
      Validates the input key. This is identical to calling validateKey(key)
      Parameters:
      key - the key to inspect.

    • validate

      public void validate(MultipartUpload mpu, String bucketName)
      Validates the MultipartUpload is for the corresponding bucket
      Parameters:
      mpu - the multipartUpload
      bucketName - the name of the bucket the multipartUpload should be for

    • validateTags

      public void validateTags(Map<String,String> tags)
      Validates that the supplied tags are not empty or null
      Parameters:
      tags - the tags to inspect

    • validate

      public void validate(PresignedUrlRequest request)
      Validates that a PresignedUrlRequest is valid
      Parameters:
      request - The presign request

    • validateEndpoint

      public void validateEndpoint(URI endpoint, boolean requirePort)
      Validates that a URI specifies the schema/protocol is http/https, and that the hostname is non-empty and non-null, and optionally validates that the port exists and is a positive values.
      Parameters:
      endpoint - The endpoint (e.g. https://proxy.example.com:8080)
      requirePort - Determines if we require a port number as part of the endpoint definition

    • validateMaxConnections

      public void validateMaxConnections(Integer maxConnections)

    • validateSocketTimeout

      public void validateSocketTimeout(Duration socketTimeout)

    • validateRange

      public void validateRange(Long start, Long end)
